record.field:
This form is used to record agricultural interventions for planting operations.

  • Intervention Type: Select the type of operation (sowing, fertilizing, protection, harvesting)
  • Land Parcel: Select the field where the operation will take place
  • GDD Tracking: Monitor growing degree days for optimal timing
  • Input Recording: Record all inputs used during the intervention

Make sure to complete GPS check-in when starting the operation to verify location compliance.

This form is used to record agricultural interventions for livestock operations.

  • Intervention Type: Select the type of operation (feeding, medical, breeding)
  • Animal Group: Select the livestock batch being treated
  • ADG Tracking: Monitor average daily gain for growth analysis
  • Withdrawal Period: Record medication and calculate safe harvest date

Ensure all medications are properly recorded to maintain withdrawal period compliance.

This form is used to record agricultural interventions for processing operations.

  • Processing Type: Select primary (sorting/cleaning), deep (transformation), or packaging
  • Energy Meters: Record start and end readings for water and electricity consumption
  • Process Parameters: Monitor temperature, pH, and other critical control points
  • Loss Rate: Track processing losses against maximum allowable rates

Ensure all quality parameters are within acceptable ranges before marking as done.

This form is used to record agricultural interventions for winemaking operations.

  • Vintage Year: Record the harvest year for traceability
  • Process Mode: Select fermentation, sterilization, or other specialized processes
  • Quality Parameters: Monitor alcohol content, Brix level, and pH throughout process
  • HACCP Compliance: Ensure all critical control points are monitored

Maintain strict temperature control during fermentation for quality wine production.

This form is used to record agricultural interventions (formerly Manufacturing Orders in industrial ERP systems).

  • Task Assignment: Link to specific farm task for resource planning
  • Input/Output Tracking: Record all materials consumed and products produced
  • Resource Allocation: Assign workers, tools, and equipment
  • Compliance Monitoring: Track quality, safety, and regulatory compliance

Complete GPS check-in and photo evidence when starting operations for full traceability.

Record harvest output by quality grade:

  • Grade A: Premium quality products meeting highest standards
  • Grade B: Good quality products with minor imperfections
  • Grade C: Lower quality products suitable for processing
  • Loss/Scrap: Record waste and unusable material in the scrap_qty field

Grade distribution affects pricing and marketability of your products.

The withdrawal period is the time between the last administration of medication/veterinary products and when the animals or their products (milk, eggs) are safe for human consumption.

  • Record medication date: When the medication was administered
  • Check product label: Follow withdrawal period specified by manufacturer
  • Monitor countdown: Track remaining days until safe for harvest/consumption
  • Prevent early sale: System will block sales before withdrawal period ends

Maintaining accurate withdrawal periods is essential for food safety and regulatory compliance.

Growing Degree Days (GDD) is a heat accumulation measurement used to predict plant development rates.

GDD = ((Maximum Temperature + Minimum Temperature) / 2) - Base Temperature

  • Base Temperature: The minimum temperature required for plant growth
  • Accumulation: GDD values accumulate over time from planting
  • Target GDD: The amount needed for specific growth stages or harvest
  • Predictive Value: Use to time interventions like harvesting, pest control

GDD helps optimize timing of agricultural operations for better yields.
